steps.text: Measure the flour into a large bowl and rub in the butter with your fingertips until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs (can also use a food processor)
Add about 3 Tablespoons of water and mix to form a firm dough
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate about 20 minutes
Preheat oven to 400°F and place a heavy baking tray in the oven to heat up
Grease a deep 7" loose bottom fluted flan tin with butter
Remove about 150g of the pastry from the main ball and set aside for lattice top
Roll the rest of the pastry out thinly on a lightly floured work surface
Line the prepared flan tin with the pastry
Prick the base with a fork to prevent rising during baking
Place reserved pastry for lattice on a sheet of plastic wrap and roll it thin
Egg wash and set in fridge, do not cut yet (do not egg wash once laid on tart)
Heat syrup gently in large pan, but do not bring to a boil
Once melted add the breadcrumbs, lemon juice, and lemon zest (add more breadcrumbs if runny)
Pour into lined tin and level the surface
Removed reserved pastry and cut into half inch wide strips, longer than the diameter of the tin
Egg wash edge of pastry in tin, and assemble woven lattice (do it separately, then flip on top)
Cut off hanging end of lattice by pressing down with hands
Bake on pre-heated tray for about 10 minutes, or until pastry has started to color
Reduce heat to 350°F and bake an additional 25-30 minutes (cover with foil if the lattice gets too dark)
Remove and let firm up in tin, serve hot or cold
